Sentencas: An investigation of the electrochemical oxidation of glycerol as alternative to hydrogen and methane in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) based on a noble metal-free anode catalyst was carried out.
Titulo: Glycerol oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells based on a Ni-perovskite electrocatalyst

Sentencas: The anode electrocatalyst consisted of a Ni-modified La(0.6)Sr(0.4)Fe(0.8)Co(0.2)O(3) (LSFCO) perovskite.
Titulo: Glycerol oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells based on a Ni-perovskite electrocatalyst

Sentencas: After thermal activation, air treatment at 1100 degrees C followed by reduction at 800 degrees C in H(2), Ni was mainly present as ultrafine La(2)NiO(4) particles homogeneously dispersed on the perovskite surface.
Titulo: Glycerol oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells based on a Ni-perovskite electrocatalyst

Sentencas: The thermal activation also caused a modification of perovskite into a lanthanum depleted structure.
Titulo: Glycerol oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells based on a Ni-perovskite electrocatalyst

Sentencas: The thermal reduction at 800 degrees C determined the occurrence of metallic Ni on the surface.
Titulo: Glycerol oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells based on a Ni-perovskite electrocatalyst

Sentencas: These results were corroborated by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), transmission electron microscopy (TEM) and X-ray diffraction (XRD).
Titulo: Glycerol oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells based on a Ni-perovskite electrocatalyst

Sentencas: A suitable power density (327 mW cm (2)) was achieved for the electrolyte supported SOFC fed with chemical-grade glycerol in almost dry condition, i.e. steam to carbon ratio (S/C) of 0.2.
Titulo: Glycerol oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells based on a Ni-perovskite electrocatalyst

Sentencas: The highest electrical efficiency (voltage efficiency) approached 50% at the peak power under mild humidification (S/C = 0.2).
Titulo: Glycerol oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells based on a Ni-perovskite electrocatalyst

Sentencas: Whereas an increase of water to glycerol ratio, caused a progressive decrease of voltage efficiency at the peak power down to 44% for S/C = 2.
Titulo: Glycerol oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells based on a Ni-perovskite electrocatalyst
